chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:44 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher D. Matz not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Christopher D. Matz. Attorney Rivard has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. Attorney Rivard states they are close to an agreement. 

Branch 1 for further scheduling.

9:41 AM Defendant Christopher D Matz appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Christopher D Matz.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Case referred to Br. 1 for scheduling an Arraignment

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher D Matz
Current: 2316 Banks Ave, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 09-14-2022)
Prior: 2535 Lynn Ave, Altoona, WI 54720

(11:10 AM case called.) Defendant Christopher D Matz appeared by video, in custody in the Douglas County Jail. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Christopher D Matz. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests the warrant be quashed and bond continue.
Court orders the warrant is quashed and bond continues.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Court orders the defendant may appear via Zoom for next court appearance and will need to be addressed for further court appearances.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 9:32 AM.
Defendant Christopher D Matz  not in court.  Attorney Francis Rivard appeared in court for Christopher D. Matz. Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appeared in ocurt for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rivard has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. 
State requests warrant. Warrant ordered.

10:21 AM case called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher D Matz appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Christopher D Matz. 
Defendant ordered to be fingerprinted by 4/23/22. 
Return to court:
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:

11:07 AM case called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Christopher D Matz appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Sonia Anderson.  
Waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. Warrant is quashed. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 2-28-22 at 2:45 PM. Return to court: 3-24-22 at 9:30 am.
